column4: Wow.  I'm impressed.  I just plugged my digital camera into my computer...and I got a pop-up window asking me if I wanted to import my digital media
Man, it can't get any easier than that.
I wonder if Linux can handle my MP3 player....

So, um, I realise that just by needing to ask this question; I'm grossly underqualified to really understand the response...but I've done lots of programming with .Net and some C++, but never anything other than boring desktop apps.  What does it take to write a hardware driver for Linux?
seems its more complex than anyone here knows :)
I really dont' know...whats the answer?
what have you done so far to configure your system for playing movies?
what would these packages be called in the error messages?
what about if you start from scratch and follow a guide and tell me what each error message is at it occurs?
k..did you download w32codecs from the link on the Restrited Formats wiki page?
k...so you then installed them using the dpkg command?
what format are the movies that don't play?
I have heard of problems with .wmv files...I don't know the details though
well thats probably a good way to go about it.
